descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description:
Jamal Mashburn scored 23 points and Elden
Campbell added 17 Saturday night as the Charlotte Hornets pulled away in the final five minutes for an 87-76 victory over Phoenix.
article.headline: Hornets still holding No. 8 spot in East
article.linkText: Marion scores 31, but Suns get burned by Hornets
article.story:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Defense did the trick for the Charlotte Hornets, who held the Phoenix Suns to 13 points in the fourth quarter Saturday night.
Mashburn

"If we keep on getting this kind of effort, we'll be fine," said Jamal Mashburn, who played 47 minutes and scored 23 points in the 87-76 victory. "As long as our defense stays consistent, we'll win a lot of games." Elden Campbell scored six of his 17 points in the final 4:34 as the Hornets opened an 81-72 lead with a 9-0 run. Though Shawn Marion scored a game-high 31 points for Phoenix, and Charlotte limited the Suns to 30-for-90 shooting. Stephon Marbury added 19 points. The Hornets, who have won two straight in a four-game homestand with huge implications for the playoffs, maintained a 1½-game edge over Miami for the eighth Eastern Conference playoff berth. Campbell broke a 72-all tie with a layup with 4:34 left and gave Charlotte a 76-72 lead with a short jumper from the lane. Baron Davis banked in a 3-pointer with 2:24 left and P.J. Brown hit a baseline jumper with 1:52 remaining to give the Hornets an 81-72 advantage. Before Charlotte's final flurry, neither team led by more than six points. "That (Davis' 3-pointer) put us over the hump right there," Charlotte coach Paul Silas said. "Before that, he hadn't really been that involved tonight." Davis had only five points in 34 minutes. "I just like the way we finished the game," Silas said. "I like the way we played defense. We held them to 13 points in the fourth quarter. I like the way we're approaching the last part of the season. We know if we keep winning, there's no way we can't make it (the playoffs)." Suns coach Frank Johson was pleased with his team's effort, but not with the way the Suns finished the game. "I'm very proud of this group," Johsnon said. "They didn't give up and they played hard. They didn't play with the poise we needed, though." With Mashburn heating up in the third period, scoring nine points in the first 5:46, Charlotte opened a 57-51 lead that disappeared quickly after Marion hit a 3-pointer and Marbury made a three-point play to give Phoenix a 63-62 lead with 1:29 left. The Hornets used an 8-0 run late in the second period to take a 44-43 lead at the half. Phoenix led 38-33 on Jake Tsakalidis' dunk with 4:37 left, but Mashburn and David Wesley hit consecutive 3-pointers to give Charlotte a 39-38 advantage. Marion led all scorers with 18 points at the break. The Suns had 12 offensive rebounds and 12 second-chance points in the first two periods, offsetting a 17-for-50 shooting performance. Charlotte took 16 fewer shots from the floor in the first half but made 16 of 24 free throws to 8-for-13 for the Suns. Game notes
Marbury has never scored fewer than 18 points in 12 games against the Hornets. ... The Hornets have won eight of the last 12 against the Suns but trail 12-17 in the all-time series. ... Silas played three seasons with the Suns (1969-1972), averaging 14.1 points and 12.1 rebounds in 239 games.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
